definition: to avoid/to evade/to keep away from
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Again, they abstained from replying to my question.
sentences.chinese: 再一次，他们避开了我的问题。

sentences.english: Janice evaded Minmei's embrace, and nodded coolly.
sentences.chinese: 贾妮斯避开了她的拥抱礼，冷淡地点点头致意。

sentences.english: Seeing her former husband, she stood aside consciously.
sentences.chinese: 一看到她的前夫，她有意避开了。

sentences.english: I suggest that you keep off political issue in negotiations with them.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你在与他们谈判时避开政治问题。

sentences.english: In other words, avoid the left side of the entire hole.
sentences.chinese: 总之，你应该尽量避开洞的整个左侧区域。

sentences.english: He skillfully parried the question with a clever reply.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地避开了那个不受欢迎的问题。

sentences.english: Everybody avoids the foreman. He acts like a Simon Legree.
sentences.chinese: 大家都避开那个工头，他的行为像个凶狠的老板。

sentences.english: When Larkshimi tried to killed the chital, she has to avoid the sharp buckhorn which will be very dangerous to the tiger.
sentences.chinese: 当老虎试图咬死白斑鹿的时候，就要避开锋利的鹿角。

sentences.english: Harry avoided his yellowish eyes as they scanned the Hall;
sentences.chinese: 他用那双黄眼睛扫视着礼堂，哈利避开了他的目光。

sentences.english: People do not want to get hurt, and will avoid you if aren’t loyal.
sentences.chinese: 人都不希望受伤害，如果你不忠诚，她们就会避开你。

sentences.english: Scientists have noted that elephants tend to avoid trees with beehives.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们指出大象往往避开有蜂房的树木。

sentences.english: They leapfrogged the enemy's main force and struck at his weak points.
sentences.chinese: 他们避开敌人主力而打击其薄弱点。

sentences.english: Avoid the Gold Digger type at all costs.
sentences.chinese: 尽可能避开拜金类型的女孩。

sentences.english: He parried the unwelcome question very skilfully.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地避开了那个不受欢迎的问题。

sentences.english: Chinese consumers responded by avoiding locally-produced milk products.
sentences.chinese: 面对这种情况，中国消费者开始避开国产乳制品。

sentences.english: If you come, the tiger will bite you.
sentences.chinese: 你会走大路还是抄小路避开老虎？

definition: to evade/to dodge
to stay out of (hot water, trouble, awkward situation etc)/to avoid (sb)
to shun/to avoid (sb)/to skirt/to evade (an issue)/to step back/to withdraw/to recuse (a judge etc)
variant of 迴避|回避[hui2 bi4]
as much as possible/to the greatest extent
as much as possible/to the greatest extent
to avert/to prevent/to avoid/to refrain from
to hide/to evade/to dodge/to take shelter/to avoid (difficulties)
to stagger (times)
to be far from/to keep away from
as far as possible/to do one's utmost
to obstruct
to run into/to come upon/to meet
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
best/(you) had better (do what we suggest)
to stop/to resist/to obstruct
to take note of/to pay attention to
